oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to Governor Tom Rye from W.L. Mitchell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: W.L. Mitchell, Chief of Department of Workshop and Factory Inspection, tells the governor about two separate court cases in Hamilton County that show violations of women and child labor laws.

Employee versus employer court cases over labor violations became more frequent as the labor movement progressed. With labor legislation in place, workers finally had the backing they needed to defend themselves against workplace injustices.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Labor; Labor laws and legislation; Labor supply; Child labor--United States; Child labor--Tennessee; Child labor--Law and legislation; Factory inspection; Factory--Law and legislation
